Rationale: Pottery is critical for early game development - enables Settlers for expansion and Granaries for food production. With my Ottoman trade route bonuses, expanding early will maximize long-term trade route benefits.

After Pottery, Mining is the logical next choice. Our exploration shows desert hills in the local area which are perfect for mines, providing key production bonuses for faster settler and unit production to support our conquest expansion strategy.

Researching Animal Husbandry first to reveal nearby Horses. If we find horses, we can pivot to The Wheel for Chariot Archers to address our NeedRangedEarly requirement. If no horses are available, we can then pursue Bronze Working for stronger ground units. This gives us flexibility while supporting our conquest strategy.

Researching The Wheel is critical for our conquest strategy. It unlocks Chariot Archers which require horses, providing us with early ranged mobile units essential for warfare. Additionally, Roads will improve connectivity and generate Gold from trade routes between cities once we expand. This complements our Animal Husbandry research (which reveals horses) and supports our NeedRangedEarly military approach.

After completing The Wheel next turn and unlocking Chariot Archers, Military Strategy is the optimal follow-up. Barracks will provide +15% combat strength for all land units, significantly boosting our early conquest capabilities. This synergizes perfectly with our Justice policy (+1 production) and existing military strategies. We need both offensive power (Chariot Archers) and unit production infrastructure (Barracks) to catch up to Venice's territorial advantage before all quality land is claimed. Fishing can wait despite our coastal location - territorial expansion is the priority on this tiny map.

Construction is the optimal choice now that we have The Wheel. Walls will provide crucial defensive capability for our only city (Istanbul) as we pursue aggressive expansion against Venice's territorial dominance. More importantly, quarries will unlock strategic resources that may be essential for our mid-game military production. With Venice at 24 territory vs our 9 and actively expanding, we need defensive infrastructure while building our military forces. Construction leads to Mathematics (catapults) and Masonry (further defensive improvements), supporting our long-term conquest strategy.

Bronze Working is critical for our conquest strategy against Venice's territorial advantage. It reveals Iron resources for future military upgrades and provides Spearmen who are strong against mounted units. With our settler arriving in 3 turns, we need to ensure military superiority to protect our expansion and eventually challenge Venice's dominance. The Iron revealed will be essential for our mid-game military production, and Spearmen will diversify our combat options beyond Warriors and Slingers.

After Bronze Working (for Spearmen), Construction is logical next for Walls (city defense) and Quarries (resource development). This supports both military expansion and economic development, with Walls being essential if we face counter-attacks during our conquest phase. Quarries will improve our resource infrastructure long-term.

Switching from Construction to Iron Working is critical for our conquest strategy. Swordsman will provide the offensive power needed to close the territorial gap with Indonesia (22) and Venice (26). With our current military strategy (WarMobilization, NeedRangedEarly) and Authority branch adoption pending, Swordsman gives us the decisive combat advantage needed for early conquest. Walls and Quarries from Construction can wait - we need military strength now.

Maintaining Iron Working research despite being on Bronze Working. The Swordsman unit will be crucial for our conquest strategy against Indonesia and Venice who have more territory than us. Iron Working provides the offensive military punch needed to close the territorial gap and support our WarMobilization strategy.

Choosing Construction after Iron Working completes to secure our expansion. Walls will strengthen city defenses as we expand territory, while Quarries provide production to build the military forces needed for our conquest strategy. This defensive preparation is crucial while we build up to Swordsmen and expand to our third city.

Continuing with Construction as planned. Walls are crucial for defending our cities, especially as we prepare for potential conflict with Indonesia who has superior military resources. Quarries will boost production to support our military buildup and infrastructure development. This tech provides both defensive security and economic strength for our conquest strategy.

Masonry is critical after Construction for several reasons: 1) It leads to Engineering which will boost our production capabilities, 2) Arena provides our first source of Tourism and production bonuses for other buildings, 3) It supports our siege warfare focus by enabling better city defenses, and 4) Works toward Metal Casting which will be essential for countering Indonesia's iron advantage with better military units.

Masonry remains the optimal next technology. It leads to Engineering for better production, provides the Arena building for Tourism bonuses, and works toward Metal Casting to counter Indonesia's iron advantage. Since our Construction research is nearing completion, Masonry will enhance our siege warfare capabilities and city defenses while providing long-term infrastructure benefits.

With Masonry finishing in 2 turns and our conquest strategy, Metal Casting is the optimal choice. It leads to Steel for superior military units and Physics for important scientific progression. This will help us overcome Indonesia's iron advantage (4 vs 3) through better unit types rather than sheer numbers.

Fishing provides crucial early-game advantages for our coastal empire. Enables work boats to harvest maritime resources (we have coastal cities), allows unit embarkation for amphibious operations against Indonesia's coastal cities, and leads to Sailing for naval expansion. Supports our conquest strategy by giving us more tactical flexibility around the Indonesian archipelago.

Researching Trapping to secure Camp improvements for Deer/Ivory/Fur/Truffles resources. This will provide early economic benefits through improved tile yields and lead toward Trade/Calendar technologies that support our long-term development. Given our negative gold per turn situation, improving resource output is crucial, and camps provide good food/gold combinations.

Critical need for gold income to resolve -5 GPT deficit. Trade unlocks Caravans and Markets, which with our unique ability (+150 Food/Science from International routes, Gold/Culture from Internal) will significantly boost economy. Also leads to Writing for Libraries, supporting our growth needs.

Researching Sailing after completing Trade to unlock Lighthouses for coastal cities (Istanbul and Edirne) and Cargo Ships for sea trade routes. This will boost our gold/food/science generation from trade routes and improve coastal city development. The Mausoleum of Halicarnassus makes trade routes particularly valuable, and sailing is a prerequisite for key Classical/Medieval technologies.

Continuing with Sailing as planned to unlock Lighthouses for coastal cities (Istanbul and Edirne) and Cargo Ships for sea trade routes. This will boost our gold/food/science generation from trade routes and improve coastal city development. Our unique ability makes international trade routes particularly valuable (+150 Food/Science), and sailing is essential for Classical/Medieval progress.

Researching Calendar after Sailing to unlock Plantations on luxury resources. This is crucial for happiness and growth, which are both essential for sustained conquest. We have several luxury resources nearby that need Plantations, and the +2 Food/Gold from improved luxuries will support our expansion strategy. Calendar also leads to Mathematics for stronger catapults and siege warfare.

With Korea planning war against us and barbarian threats, Mathematics is essential for building Skirmishers and improving our military strength. The Skirmisher mobility will help counter Korean plans and the Engineering path will enhance our infrastructure for long-term conquest. Writing can wait as we need immediate military capabilities.

Choosing Engineering over Writing due to impending Korean threat. Engineering provides critical defensive infrastructure (Forts) to strengthen border positions, Aqueducts to support population growth for larger military capacity, and bridges for improved unit mobility. These defensive benefits are essential now that Korea is 'Planning War' and our military posture is EmpireDefense. Writing's Library bonus would be nice for long-term science but is secondary to immediate survival needs.

Choosing Writing to build Libraries and boost our science output. With Engineering completed, we need to improve our research rate to keep pace with technologically advanced Korea. Libraries will provide essential science infrastructure for our 4 cities, while embassies will improve diplomatic visibility. The science boost is critical for maintaining technological parity as we prepare for potential Korean aggression.

Researching Philosophy next to unlock Temples for faith generation and Courthouses to reduce unhappiness from conquered cities. This supports our conquest strategy by religious infrastructure and maintaining happiness during expansion. Philosophy also enables Education path toward critical science buildings. Current 25 science/turn will complete this efficiently after Writing finishes.

Continue with Philosophy research to unlock Temples for faith generation and Courthouses for happiness management in conquered cities. This directly supports our conquest strategy by providing religious infrastructure and maintaining stability during expansion. At 27 science/turn, this research will complete efficiently after Writing.

Engineering provides critical infrastructure for conquest through Aqueducts (supporting city growth and population), bridges for improved military mobility across rivers, and leads to Steel for advanced military units. This supports our current Conquest strategy while addressing the growth needs of our expanding empire, especially important with new cities like Konya and our ongoing military buildup against the Korean threat.

With Korea showing 'Planning War' stance and our conquest strategy ongoing, Steel provides critical military upgrades. Longswordsman offers offensive superiority over current Swordsmen, and Armory accelerates unit experience gains. This technology directly enhances our invasion capabilities while fitting perfectly with our Golden Age production boost and WarMobilization strategy.

With Korea's 'Planning War' stance confirmed and our conquest strategy ongoing, Steel is critical for military superiority. Longswordsman will provide significant offensive advantage over current Swordsmen, and the Armory building will accelerate unit experience gains. This directly supports our WarMobilization strategy and Golden Age production boost, preparing us for the inevitable Korean conflict.

Steel research remains critical for Longswordsman production to counter Korea's 'Planning War' stance. With 4 Iron resources available and Golden Age production bonus, upgrading from Swordsmen to Longswordsman will provide decisive military advantage. This directly supports our Conquest strategy and WarMobilization economic approach.

Researching Currency after Steel will provide the Caravansary building to boost land trade route range and value, plus additional trade route slot. This supports economic growth during continued war campaign and enhances our unique Ottoman trade route ability (+150 Food/Science for international routes). Village improvements will also increase gold generation to fund military operations.

Currency research is critical to address our negative gold income (-10 GPT). The Caravansary building will boost land trade route value and range, while granting an additional trade route slot. This synergizes perfectly with Ottoman unique ability (+150 Food/Science for international routes) and will help fund continued military operations against Korea. Village improvements will increase gold generation to resolve our treasury deficit.

Currency research (2 turns from Steel) is still urgently needed to address our worsening -5 GPT deficit. The Caravansary building will boost land trade route value and provide an additional trade route slot, synergizing with Ottoman unique ability for +150 Food/Science on international routes. This will help stabilize our treasury and fund continued military operations against Korea despite the deepening financial crisis.

Critical need for siege weapons to break Korean defenses and potentially end the costly war faster. Trebuchets provide significant advantage against cities while being more cost-effective than multiple standard units. With our financial crisis worsening (-5 GPT), accelerating war conclusion is essential to reduce military expenses. Physics also leads to Machinery for further military improvements.

Continuing research toward Machinery for Crossbowmen is optimal for our Korean campaign. While Physics leads to Trebuchets, getting Crossbowmen first provides stronger ranged support without the technological leap requirement. Crossbowmen (14 ranged strength vs Composite Bowman's 9) will significantly improve our siege capabilities against Korean cities, especially with our new Siege Foundry bonus. This maintains war momentum while we work toward better siege units later.

Continuing research toward Machinery for Crossbowmen is critical for our Korean campaign. Crossbowmen (14 ranged strength vs Composite Bowman's 9) will significantly improve our siege capabilities against defended Korean cities like Jeonju and Busan. While Physics provides foundation for Trebuchets, getting Crossbowmen first gives us stronger ranged support more quickly, maintaining war momentum. Our Siege Foundry bonus and existing army will benefit greatly from this firepower upgrade.

Machinery continues to be our top priority as Crossbowmen (14 ranged strength vs Composite Bowman's 9) will dramatically improve our siege capabilities against Korean cities. Jeonju and Busan remain strongly defended, and the firepower upgrade from Crossbowmen will be decisive in breaking these stalemates. While Physics provides the foundation for Trebuchets, Crossbowmen give us immediate combat superiority to maintain war momentum. Our Siege Foundry bonus will make these units even more effective.

Choosing Drama and Poetry to unlock Amphitheaters for additional Culture generation. This will help accelerate our policy acquisition (currently at 37% for Cultural Victory consideration) while also providing Great Work slots. The happiness from cultural buildings will address our 42% happiness situation, and this technology leads to Education which we'll need for Science capabilities. Given we just made peace with Korea and have 10 turns of peace treaty, focusing on cultural development while we rebuild our military for the next confrontation is optimal timing.

Education is the optimal choice now that Machinery is complete. Universities will boost Science output significantly (currently 102 SPT), accelerating our technological advantage over Korea. Education also enables Research Agreements which could be valuable with Indonesia/Venice. Science lead translates to better military units and infrastructure for conquest. We're in Medieval Era and strong Science positioning will help us reach key military and economic technologies faster for the upcoming war with Korea.

With Education completing in ~4-5 turns and peace treaty with Korea expiring in ~8-10 turns, Chivalry is the optimal next technology. Knights will provide crucial mobile power and siege complement to our existing Longswordsman-Crossbowman-Trebuchet core. Castles will significantly boost city defenses across our empire, particularly important for newly settled Diyarbakir and vulnerable coastal cities. The timing perfectly aligns with our war preparations against Korea, ensuring stronger siege capabilities and mobile force projection when hostilities resume.

Need to prioritize Gunpowder research path for Janissaries (Ottoman unique Musketman replacement) before war with Korea resumes. Compass provides additional trade route to boost economy while progressing toward Gunpowder. Janissaries will be critical for breaking through Korean fortifications and the new harbor building supports naval operations against coastal Korean cities.

Continuing toward Gunpowder for Janissaries. Despite current Chivalry research, Compass provides additional trade route (+23 GPT potential) for economy and Harbor building for naval operations against Korea. Janissaries will be decisive when peace treaty expires - they'll replace current Longswordsmen and provide the technological edge needed against Korean fortified positions.

Progressing toward Gunpowder unlocks our Janissary unique unit which replaces Musketman. With Korea isolated and weakened (losing to Indonesia), securing this military advantage will be decisive for our conquest strategy. The timing aligns perfectly with our positioned forces ready for offensive operations once peace treaty expires. Janissaries will provide superior firepower for the final push against Korean cities.

Choosing Chemistry as next research after Gunpowder to support continued conquest. Grocers will boost city growth essential for military production and unit support, while Chemistry leads to Navigation and Metallurgy which will strengthen our naval capabilities and access to better military units for the final push against Korea and potential future conflicts.

Continuing optimal conquest strategy against Korea. Chemistry provides Grocers for city growth and leads to Navigation/Metallurgy for enhanced military capabilities. This supports our war effort by improving our economic foundation while preparing for stronger naval and land forces. Theology would provide happiness benefits but Chemistry better serves our immediate conquest goals.

Continuing our military advancement to support Indonesia's conquest of Korea. Metallurgy provides Lancers which will be crucial mobile units to complement our Janissaries and Cannons. With Korea already weakened (66% war weariness) and Indonesia dominating the war, this tech will help us provide better military support while protecting our interests against potential Venice involvement if diplomatic situation deteriorates.

Continuing our military tech progression to support Indonesia's conquest of Korea. Metallurgy unlocks Lancers which will provide crucial mobile cavalry to complement our Janissaries and Cannons. With Korea suffering 69% war weariness and losing badly to Indonesia, this tech timing is perfect to potentially join the war if needed or provide stronger deterrent against Venice involvement. Lancers will also improve our strategic mobility for the upcoming conquest phase against remaining targets.

Continuing military tech progression is crucial as Indonesia systematically dismantles Korea. Metallurgy unlocks Lancers which will provide essential mobile cavalry to complement our strong Janissary and Cannon forces. With Korea at 81% war weariness and losing badly, this timing positions us to either join the war decisively or provide stronger deterrence against Venice intervention. Lancers will improve our strategic mobility for the upcoming conquest phase against remaining targets.

Continuing Metallurgy research for better military units. This aligns with our conquest strategy and will provide access to superior military technologies for our ongoing wars against Korea and Venice. While Indonesia does the heavy lifting against Korea, better units will help us capture cities before Indonesia does and prepare for future conflicts.

Continuing Metallurgy is crucial as it unlocks better military units including our Janissary upgrade path and improved siege equipment. With Indonesia rapidly conquering Korean cities and us facing severe happiness penalties, we need superior military technology to capture remaining Korean cities quickly before Indonesia takes them all. Better units will also prepare us for the inevitable Venice conflict due to their defensive pact with Korea.

Critical need for naval superiority and strategic mobility. Indonesian Djongs threaten our coastal operations and we need ocean crossing capability to reach Korean cities faster. Astronomy unlocks Observatory for Science boost and leads to Navigation for advanced naval units that can counter Indonesian naval threats while supporting our rapid conquest of remaining Korean cities.

Astronomy remains essential - we just captured Busan and need ocean crossing capability to reach remaining Korean cities faster than Indonesia. Indonesian Djongs threaten our coastal operations, and the Observatory Science boost will support our tech progression. Navigation (follow-on tech) will provide advanced naval units to counter Djongs while supporting rapid conquest.

Critical for naval superiority against Indonesia's Djongs and Venice. Frigates and Corvettes will give us the firepower needed to control sea lanes and protect our coastal conquest. Also provides Bastion Forts for stronger city defenses during continued expansion. Indonesia already has coastal presence and naval power is essential for our conquest victory.

Critical military upgrade for Indonesia confrontation. With Navigation completed, Rifling provides Fusiliers - superior frontline infantry that will be essential for both offensive operations against Indonesian cities and defensive operations against their mounted units. Indonesia has fielded Knights and other mounted forces that current Janissaries struggle against. Fusiliers will give us the combat edge needed in the multi-front war situation. This supports our conquest strategy against the dominant Indonesian civilization that controls 50% of capitals.

Military technology upgrade critical for Indonesia war. With Navigation research complete, Rifling provides Fusiliers - superior frontline infantry that will counter Indonesian Knights and give us combat advantage. Indonesia is fielding advanced units (Cannons, Heavy Skirmishers) and we need the next tier of military tech to compete effectively. This supports our conquest strategy against the dominant Indonesian civilization that controls 50% of capitals and has superior diplomatic position.

Military Science provides crucial cavalry units which will be highly effective against Indonesia's current forces and help us maintain offensive momentum. The Military Academy will boost experience for our units, making them more effective in battle. This directly supports our conquest strategy against Indonesia while we have them in a weakened state before their Golden Age advantages fully kick in.

Continuing with Military Science is critical - we need Cavalry units to counter Indonesia's numerical advantage near Seoul where they have 661 strength vs our 477. The Military Academy will provide experience bonuses to sustain our war effort. This directly supports our conquest strategy against Indonesia which controls 50% of capitals and poses an existential threat.

Continuing with Military Science is critical for our conquest strategy against Indonesia. We need Cavalry units to counter their numerical advantage, especially near Seoul where enemy strength (820) still exceeds ours (580). The Military Academy will provide crucial experience bonuses to sustain our war effort. This directly supports our goal of conquering Indonesia to prevent their domination victory.

Military Science is absolutely essential for our war with Indonesia. We need Cavalry units to counter their numerical advantage in the Seoul theater where enemy strength (816) exceeds ours (344). The Military Academy will provide crucial combat experience bonuses to sustain our war effort and reduce attrition. With Indonesia at 50% domination victory, we cannot afford technological stagnation - this directly supports our conquest strategy to prevent Indonesia's victory.

Military Science remains absolutely critical despite recent combat losses. We need Cavalry units to break the stalemate at Seoul where Indonesia holds 50% domination victory territory. The Military Academy will provide crucial combat experience bonuses that will reduce attrition and help maintain our war effort. With Indonesia holding both Jakarta and Seoul, we cannot afford any delay in military technological advancement - this directly counters their numerical advantage and supports our conquest strategy to prevent their victory.

While we're in Industrial era, completing Civil Service provides valuable benefits for our current war effort: farms near rivers/lakes get +1 Food which will help grow our key military production cities like Istanbul (23 pop) and Ankara (17 pop), and unlocks Pikemen which are strong anti-cavalry units. Our current war against Indonesia requires maximum city production capacity, and the additional food will support larger populations for more unit production. The Pikemen counter will also be useful as Indonesia has cavalry units (Cuirassiers).

While Civil Service is set, Steel is far more critical for our current war against Indonesia. Indonesia controls 50% of capitals for domination victory and we're at a critical moment around Seoul. Steel unlocks Field Guns (40 ranged strength vs current Great Bombards at 43 but with better availability) and Frigates. Our current siege capabilities are insufficient against Seoul's defenses - we need more Field Guns to break through Indonesian fortifications. With Military Science nearly complete and giving us Cavalry, Steel will complement this by dramatically improving our siege warfare capabilities to take Seoul before Indonesia can consolidate.

Steel remains our critical research priority. With Korea capitulated and Indonesia at 50% capital control, we must break through Seoul's defenses immediately. We just upgraded our first Cannon to Field Gun (40 ranged strength) and Steel will unlock more Field Guns to replace our remaining Cannons. Indonesia still has 717 strength in Seoul zone vs our 346, so we need the siege advantage Steel provides. The war is at a critical juncture - falling back now lets Indonesia consolidate their position.

The battle for Seoul is critical - Indonesia has 892 strength vs our 435, and they just built a Circus there boosting their defenses. Our Field Guns (40 ranged) are helping but we need more to overcome entrenched Indonesian forces. Steel unlocks additional Field Gun production to replace our remaining Cannons, giving us the siege advantage needed to break through Seoul's defenses. With Indonesia at 50% domination victory control, we cannot afford to lose momentum - every turn we delay gives them time to consolidate their position.

Steel is critical for the Seoul battle - our Field Guns (40 ranged strength) are effective but Indonesia still outnumbers us 1001 vs 420 in the Seoul zone. Steel enables more Field Gun production to replace remaining Cannons, giving us the siege advantage needed to break through entrenched Indonesian defenses before Indonesia consolidates their 50% domination victory control.

Steel is absolutely critical for the Seoul battle. Our current Field Gun advantage (40 vs 29 ranged) isn't enough against Indonesia's 792 vs 644 strength advantage. Steel enables upgrading our remaining Cannons to Field Guns, giving us superior siege firepower to break Seoul's 77% Health defense. Indonesia is researching advanced techs while we're at Military Science - Steel ( unlocks better production speed and unit strength) is our only path to overcoming entrenched Indonesian field guns and securing Seoul before Indonesia consolidates their 50% Domination Victory control.

Banking provides Banks (Gold bonus) and Constabularies (spy defense) which are crucial now. With Indonesia at 50% Domination Victory, I need Banks to boost Gold income for emergency military purchases and continued war funding. Constabularies protect against Indonesian espionage given our ongoing war. This supports our GsConquest strategy by ensuring we can afford the war effort despite 35% war weariness penalties, while also securing our technology from Indonesian theft attempts.

Printing Press is critical for our war effort against Indonesia's 50% Domination Victory threat. It enables Diplomatic Units that ignore terrain costs - essential for coordinating with our Venice defensive pact ally and moving envoys to contested city-states rapidly. Also leads to Architecture for better defenses and Economics to offset our war costs. Indonesia is already Industrial Era, so we cannot afford to fall behind on key technologies while fighting this existential threat.

Printing Press is absolutely critical for our existential war against Indonesia. With Indonesia at 50% Domination Victory, we cannot afford to fall behind. This technology enables Diplomatic Units that ignore terrain costs - game-changing for coordinating with our Venice defensive pact ally and rapidly moving envoys to contested Indonesian city-state allies like Ormus, Geneva, Nippur, Marrakech, Dublin. Indonesia already controls 5 major city-states (Ormus, Dublin, Marrakech, Nippur, Geneva) with massive delegate advantages (14 vs our 5). We need diplomatic mobility to break this dominance. Printing Press also leads to Architecture for better defensive structures and Economics to offset war costs. The terrain-ignoring diplomatic units could be decisive in preventing Indonesia from reaching 75% Domination Victory by denying them additional allied city-states.

Economics provides an additional Trade Route - crucial for maintaining economic pressure while funding our total war against Indonesia. With Indonesia at 50% Domination Victory (2/4 capitals controlled), we need maximum economic flexibility to sustain the military push for Seoul and Jakarta. The Windmill production bonus will help accelerate Field Gun/Janissary production, and extra gold can fund diplomatic efforts to break Indonesia's city-state stranglehold (5 allies vs our 1) that gives them 14 vs 5 World Congress delegate advantage.

Choosing Architecture over Acoustics despite our conquest focus because Wonders available in this tree (like Chichen Itza, Taj Mahal, Oxford University) provide critical bonuses: Chichen Itza gives 15% combat bonus to all units for siege operations, Taj Mahal provides free Golden Age +20% production during wartime, and Oxford University boosts Science for faster military tech progression. With Indonesia at 50% Domination Victory, we need every advantage to break Seoul (48 def) and Jakarta (51 def). Architecture's wonder bonuses will significantly enhance our military effectiveness more than Acoustics' cultural Opera House.

Scientific Theory is critical for our military buildup against Indonesia's 50% Domination Victory threat. It unlocks Public Schools for higher Science output and leads to Archaeology and Fertilizer, accelerating us toward superior military technologies. While Acoustics provides culture, we need the technological edge to break through Seoul's 48 Defense and Jakarta's 51 Defense. Our 8-turn Golden Age window combined with Scientific Theory's science boost will maximize our research rate for critical military tech.

With Golden Age ending this turn and Indonesia at 50% Domination Victory, Railroad (from Acoustics branch) provides critical strategic mobility for rapid troop redeployment. Indonesia is distracted fighting Venice (90% winning), giving us window to capitalize. Railroad allows faster concentration of forces against Seoul (55 Defense) and Jakarta (40 Defense) before our Golden Age combat bonus expires. Archaeology would support cultural victory but Military conquest remains highest priority given immediate threat level.

Railroad is critical for our war effort against Indonesia's 75% Domination Victory threat. The +50% production in cities with Railroads will dramatically accelerate military unit production for the final push. Additional Trade Route provides more economic resources to sustain total war. Most importantly, faster unit movement allows rapid redeployment of our Field Guns and siege forces to threaten Seoul (55 Defense) and Jakarta (40 Defense) before Indonesia can consolidate their victory. Our existing Coal resources (14) ensure immediate availability without resource constraints.

Steam Power is critical for our defense against Indonesia's 75% Domination Victory threat. Revealing Coal (we have 14) enables access to Industrialization and Dynamite - the latter provides Artillery units with devastating 60 Ranged Strength that can neutralize Indonesia's technological advantage. Our current military struggles against Indonesian Forces need serious firepower reinforcement, especially as they continue assaulting our cities like Marsin. Steam Power also enhances our Production capacity for faster unit replacement, crucial given our combat losses this turn.

Steam Power is absolutely essential after Malatya's capture. Indonesia's 75% Domination Victory threat requires immediate access to Artillery (60 Ranged Strength) via Dynamite to counter their Gatling Guns (44 Ranged) and naval dominance. Our current Field Guns (40 Ranged) are insufficient against their technological superiority. Steam Power reveals our substantial Coal reserves (14) for production boosts and leads to Industrialization for enhanced economic capacity. Naval vessel upgrades are critical as Indonesia continues coastal assaults - we lost a Frigate last turn and need stronger warships to protect remaining coastal cities from their Ironclad fleet.

Indonesia's navy dominates with Ironclads (55 Strength) vs our Corvettes/Frigates (40/25 Strength). Steam Power alone is insufficient - we need Dynamite to unlock Artillery for superior coastal bombardment against Indonesia's naval superiority. Our Great Bombards need Artillery upgrades to effectively defend coastal cities from Indonesian Ironclads and Cruisers. Indonesia's 75% Domination progress requires immediate technological response before they capture more capitals.

Indonesia at 75% Domination Victory requires immediate access to Artillery (40 ranged strength) to counter their Gatling Guns and Field Guns. Dynamite technology unlocks Artillery which is critical for breaking Indonesian defensive positions around their remaining targets. Cannot delay - Indonesia could capture their final capital at any moment.

Indonesia at 75% Domination Victory remains the existential threat requiring immediate Artillery access. Dynamite unlocks Artillery (40 ranged strength) to counter their Gatling Guns (44 ranged) and Field Guns (40 ranged). Cannot delay this research - each turn Indonesia gets closer to capturing their final capital. Artillery is essential for breaking Indonesian defensive positions and counter-attacking their remaining targets.

Indonesia's 75% Domination Victory progress with Modern era technology requires immediate Artillery access. Dynamite unlocks Artillery (40 ranged strength) to counter their Gatling Guns (44 ranged) and Field Guns (40 ranged). Cannot delay - each turn Indonesia moves closer to capturing their final capital. Artillery is essential for breaking Indonesian defensive positions and counter-attacking their remaining targets.

After Dynamite completes, Indonesia's Modern era naval supremacy (Ironclads 55 strength, Cruisers 40/55) requires immediate upgrading. Combustion unlocks Landship (incredibly powerful armored unit that can move after attacking) and Arsenal (+city strength). With Indonesia at 75% Domination Victory, cannot afford delay - each turn their superior navy and land units advance closer to capturing their final capital. Must obtain Landship to match their armored capabilities and Arsenal to strengthen coastal cities against amphibious assaults.

Combustion research must continue as the absolute top priority. Indonesia has Modern era technology with Ironclads (55 strength) overwhelming our Corvettes (40 strength). Completing Combustion unlocks Landships and other critical military units that can actually challenge Indonesia's technological superiority. With Indonesia at 75% Domination victory and threatening multiple win conditions, we cannot afford to delay this crucial technological upgrade that will give us a fighting chance on both land and sea.

Critical military research needed - Indonesia has Modern era Riflemen while we still have落后 units. Riflemen (50 Strength) will replace our weaker Janissaries/Fusiliers and can actually counter Indonesia's land forces. With Indonesia just 3 turns from cultural victory and 75% domination victory, we need immediate military parity to survive the existential threat.

Game-ending threat from Indonesia requiring Riflemen for military parity. Indonesia has Modern era Riflemen (50 Strength) while our units maximum strength is 40 (Landship/Cavalry). Replaceable Parts enables Riflemen to finally counter Indonesia's overwhelming military advantage. Without Riflemen, we cannot defend against Indonesian Light Tanks and Artillery with our current weaker units. Indonesia is just 3 turns from cultural victory AND 75% domination victory - every turn counts for military survival.

CRITICAL MILITARY TECHNOLOGY - Facing Indonesian Machine Guns (58 ranged strength) and Light Tanks means we need Anti-Aircraft Guns and Machine Guns urgently. Ballistics provides Machine Gun production essential for matching Indonesian firepower, and Anti-Aircraft Guns for future air threat defense. Replaceable Parts will be completed soon, but Ballistics must come next to counter immediate Indonesian technological superiority in ranged combat. Our Gatling Guns (44 ranged) are outmatched by Indonesian Machine Guns (58) - this technology gap must be closed immediately for survival.

CRITICAL TECHNOLOGY FOR SURVIVAL - Indonesia's cultural victory continues ticking (3-4 turns from Influential status) while fielding Machine Guns (58 ranged strength) and Light Tanks against our Gatling Guns (44 ranged) and Landships. Ballistics gives us Machine Guns to match Indonesian firepower parity and Anti-Aircraft Guns for future air defense. Indonesian economic dominance (1159 GPT vs our 17) and technological superiority require us to close the combat power gap immediately - Honor's combat bonus alone cannot compensate for 14-point ranged strength differences in sustained combat.

URGENT MILITARY TECHNOLOGICAL PARITY - Indonesia has Light Tanks (60 strength) dominating our Gatling Guns. Combined Arms will unlock Tanks to match their armored units. Current Ballistics research gives Machine Guns (58 ranged) but we still vulnerable to Light Tanks. Need Tanks (strength 60) + Machine Gun upgrades to counter Indonesian armored superiority. Indonesia at 58 techs vs our 50 - must close gap to prevent conquest defeat while they're at 75% domination victory.
